-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | Quasiquoters for HaTeX
--   
@package HaTeX-qq
@version 0.0.1.1


-- | Since 0.0.1.0
module Text.LaTeX.Utils

-- | Strip whitespaces on both sides of LaTeX.
--   
--   Since 0.0.1.0
stripTeX :: LaTeX -> LaTeX

-- | Strip whitespaces on the right side of LaTeX.
--   
--   Since 0.0.1.0
stripTeXR :: LaTeX -> LaTeX

-- | Strip whitespaces on the left side of LaTeX.
--   
--   Since 0.0.1.0
stripTeXL :: LaTeX -> LaTeX

module Text.LaTeX.QQ

-- | HaTeX quasiquoter. antiquote should be of the form of
--   <tt>hask{...}</tt>. This quasiquoter is whitespace-sensitive both in
--   input and output. You need <tt>OverloadedStrings</tt> language
--   extension for pattern quotes.
--   
--   Since 0.0.0.0
hat :: QuasiQuoter

-- | Whitespace-insensitive version of <a>hat</a>. This ignores whtiespace
--   at both sides, but not deeper inside because this might break Math
--   spacing. Pattern quote requires <tt>ViewPatterns</tt> in addition.
--   
--   Since 0.0.0.0
hat' :: QuasiQuoter

-- | General macro to generate quasiquoter for HaTeX. If the second
--   argument is <tt>True</tt>, you also need <tt>ViewPatterns</tt>.
--   
--   NOTE: Due to TH's stage restriction, you have to use this function in
--   an other module than you call the resulting quasiquotes.
--   
--   Since 0.0.0.0
mkHaTeXQQ :: String -> Bool -> QuasiQuoter
